metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19530 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.2.10, there is a use-after-free bug that canbe caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/usb/class/cdc-acm.cdriver, aka CID-c52873e5a1ef.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19530` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-166.195
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1060.67
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1096.107
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1051.53~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1060.65
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1046.49
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1026.29~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1124.133
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1128-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1128.136
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-166.195').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-65.74~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.67').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1096.107').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.53~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.65').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1046.49').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1026.29~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.133').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1128.136').
